item.title: By: bfp
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: <a href="http://machaggis.net/bluefacedpixie/index.php/2007/03/08/lessons-in-spam/" rel="nofollow">you have no idea</a>, but it's surprising how well it works - I need one for new user registrations too, I get about one bogus new user registration a day.
item.content:encoded: you have no idea, but it’s surprising how well it works – I need one for new user registrations too, I get about one bogus new user registration a day.

item.title: By: e

item.description: PS that's a challenging spam prevention mechanism there on the comment feature.
item.content:encoded: PS that’s a challenging spam prevention mechanism there on the comment feature.

item.title: By: e
item.dc:creator: e
item.description:
Love it. Using it already. Where else can I customize french, italian, american and canadian news all together and just breeze over it with a mouse? In 5 minutes I'm updated in multiple languages without ever waiting for another page to load.
I love maps of information representation too. I seem to remember <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Visual-Display-Quantitative-Information-2nd/dp/0961392142/ref=si3_rdr_bb_product/002-3248009-8307232" rel="nofollow">a really cool book</a> I borrowed from the library once.
cheers e.
item.content:encoded:
Love it. Using it already. Where else can I customize french, italian, american and canadian news all together and just breeze over it with a mouse? In 5 minutes I’m updated in multiple languages without ever waiting for another page to load.

I love maps of information representation too. I seem to remember a really cool book I borrowed from the library once.

cheers
e.
